img.alt: Students engaged in school work at home

div.p: RCOE provides technical assistance, resources, professional development, data access/analysis, and school review and support teams to assist districts and schools directly during school closures. Our goal is to ensure all students graduate from high school well prepared for college and the workforce. We maintain and develop special programs through RCOE, and work with regional partners, to build the capacity of our educators in meeting this goal.

The RCOE team offers support in mathematics, reading/language arts, science, social studies, technology, the visual/performing arts, assessment, and environmental education; including special programs and resources supporting California Standards, Multiliteracy, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math), leadership, early learning, MTSS, and UDL planning.

During the school closure, we are here to directly support your districts or schools by creating virtual professional development, collaborating in designing remote learning options, and providing enrichment resources.

li.a: Teacher, Interrupted: Leaning into Social-Emotional Learning Amid the COVID-19 Crisis
Collaborative Learning Solutions (CLE) Daily Socio-Emotional Learning
li.br: This website offers an interactive “Daily SEL Lesson” feature that provides students and families important information around self-care, mental health and coping strategies. (Elementary, Middle, High School)

li.a: OCDE Integrating SEL Within Distance Learning
li.br: SEL and distance learning resources, and registration for an online conversation on April 28.

div.p: Contact Catalina Cifuentes, ccifuentes@rcoe.us, Gil Compton, gcompton@rcoe.us, and Pedro Caro, pcaro@rcoe.us

Students: This section lists resources for delivering content to students. Best practice would be to start by leveraging some of the resources that you already use in your face-to-face instruction. Additionally, check your district to see what is already available to you and supported by your district’s IT department.

*Disclaimer: Some apps collect a certain amount of user data. It is imperative that you check with your IT department before using apps that require student accounts. Find out more by visiting the website for the CA Student Data Privacy Alliance.

tr.td: This resource offers a “daily schedule” of educational enrichment activities students of all ages can do to stay engaged in academics.
Designed for middle and high school students, this tool can be used to explore college and career pathways through a variety of interactive links.
This interactive tool allows students to assess their interest and identify possible careers based on their interests.
This resource offers easy-to-use and kid-friendly activities around college and career exploration and a host of information for parents.
Primarily designed for middle, high and older elementary students, this website offers interactive activities around 15 career sectors that students can explore.
This website is offered by the University of California system and lets students and families take virtual tours of all 11 UC campuses to get a taste of student life.
This resource offers a variety of links that help students explore over 100 topics related to mental, emotional and physical health through videos and activities.

Content Annotation Notes
California State Library K-12 Online Content Project This free resource supports learning and research opportunities with free access to Encyclopedia Britannica, Teaching Books.net, and ProQuest May need to use single signon login information. Otherwise, contact your site or district library staff for more information.
CK-12 This resource offers a host of online textbooks, simulations, and study guides that are free to teachers and students. Many can be linked to learning management systems and tools such as Google Classroom Free
Discovery Education A host of video and lessons for most content areas as well as lesson plans and professional learning for effective 21st century instructional practices. Requires an account
Epic Books Massive resources for online reading of all text types. Free to parents right now.
Gooru A collection of free online resources for almost any content area. Free
kids.nationalgeographic.com Books, articles, photos, science experiments, etc. Free
Project Gutenberg A free collection of of 61,000 downloadable classic texts Free
Scholastic Learn at Home Every day includes four separate learning experiences, each built around a thrilling, meaningful story or video. Kids can do them on their own, with their families, or with their teachers. Free
Virtual Gifted and Talented Enrichment Support Materials (from Kentucky) Grades K-12; Critical thinking, creativity, leadership, visual arts, drama, dance, music, language arts, math, science, social studies
AP English Writing Clinic A free 3-week AP English Writing clinic
Khan Academy A wide variety of topics, content areas, and lessons for all grade levels. Math – This is aligned directly with Illustrative Math/Open Up for 6th-8th Grade
Squiggle Park | Level up your early readers. Reading
Storyline Online Virtual storybook site
Storyplace Website where students can hear digital storybooks (option to change to Spanish) Dual Language Target Language Spanish
Newsela Complimentary access to Newsela during closures
My Writing Coach Free writing lessons aligned to CCSS and ELPAC
Age of Learning Free access during closures to ABC Mouse, Adventure Academy and ReadingIQ Pre-K to 8th
Step Up to Writing Free video from Voyager Sopris Learning explaining Opinion Writing in the elementary setting Grades 3-5 Supporting a Point of View. Additional resources at stepuptowriting.com
J.K. Rowling grants open license for teachers during Covid-19 outbreak
Audible by Amazon

STEM Content
Mathematics
DreamBox Learning
An adaptive, online K-8 math program proven to raise student achievement while supporting informed decision making.
90-day free trial. Requires students to create account
Available in Spanish
Desmos Classroom Activities
A collection of free and engaging digital and interactive activities for teachers and students to help every student learn math and love learning math. The teacher platform allows teachers to manage the student platform. Students join classroom activities using a class code created by the teacher.
Free Teacher and student platforms. Requires the teacher to create an account.
Desmos Student platform also available.
Desmos Free Graphing Utility
Graph functions, plot data, evaluate equations, explore transformations, and much more.
Free Graphing Utility. Creating an account allows teachers and students to save their work.
illustrativemathematics.org
Explore the growing library of free resources, designed to help educators understand and implement the standards. You’ll find instructional and assessment tasks, blog posts, curriculum blueprints, videos, downloadable documents, and more.
Free Math Task
Math tasks may be downloaded, printed or posted on learning management systems to use with students at home.
Mathematics Assessment Project
Grade 6 – HS free downloadable lessons and tasks focused on developing math concepts and problem-solving of non-routine problems.
Free math lessons and tasks
Math tasks may be downloaded, printed or posted on learning management systems to use with students at home.
Inside Mathematics
Grade 2-12 resources such as math tasks, re-engagement lessons and videos including connections of the math standards and social and emotional learning
Free math lessons and tasks
Math tasks may be downloaded, printed or posted on learning management systems to use with students at home.
Which One Doesn’t Belong
Observe and reflect upon a graphic displaying four images. Students will then apply their mathematical and reasoning skills, compare and contrast the structure and regularity to decide which of the four items does not belong and also justify why their choice is valid.
Free
MathVisuals
Visualizes math concepts to be more easily understood.
Free
Mathalicious
Real-world lessons help MS and HS teachers address standards while challenging their students to think about the world.
Checkout Coronavirus Pandemic lesson
Several free lessons available – select free lesson filter. Other lessons available for a fee.
Knowledge Building On the Go
SFUSD Math Elementary School Closure Lessons
Teacher Professional Development
New Perspectives on Learning
K-6 math online platform for PLC PD modules on number strings and student conferring as well as modules on the Context for Learning materials
Contact Cathy Fosnot for free access to online platform @ctfosnot or New Perspectives on Learning Contact Form
Resources that Support Purchased Programs/Textbook Adoptions
Greatminds – Eureka Math
Daily Lessons at each grade level starting Wednesday 3/17.
K-8 mathematics (also has science and ELA)
Zearn.org
K-8 Math with lessons and practice online. Teacher needs to setup classroom and add students. Students join with classroom code.
Math – Aligned to Eureka Math for K-8th Grade
MoMath Museum – for fee services
Online field trips
fieldtrips.momath.org
Educators, bring your students together with an experienced MoMath educator for an engaging online field trip session, fully accessible from home.
Registration required. Fees vary
Limited sponsored trips may be available for Title I schools.
Home Enrichment
studentsessions.momath.org
Break the boredom of being at home with a journey into the wonderful and intriguing world of mathematics, guided by an experienced MoMath educator. Parents, enroll your children in engaging, interactive math exploration.
Registration required. $50 per 45 minute session
Zoom platform required – this is a free platform. Multiple family members may attend via Zoom put only one link and device per household
Online MathPlay
For preschoolers
MathPlay offers children the opportunity to play well-developed games that help broaden math skills, improve problem-solving skills, and fine-tune motor coordination and social skills.
Fees vary

Contact Yamileth Shimojyo, yshimojyo@rcoe.us, Greg Nicholas, gnicholas@rcoe.us

Additional Tools Annotation Notes
Adobe Spark Create short videos, and graphics Free and paid features
BrainPOP Variety of short animated video lessons on multiple topics Free and paid content
Canvas Learning management system Free for teachers
Code.org Implement the computer science standards. Set up classes, track progress and deliver self-paced lessons to students Free
Flipgrid Record and share short videos. Free
Free Online Teaching Support Group Virtual professional learning community to support educators (PreK-16) in this transition to online education.
Gimkit Gamified quizzes and assessment. Adds a collaborative element. Free and paid features
Google Classroom Learning management system Free
Google Hangouts Meet Chat, or hold video conference with groups Free with some paid features like the ability to record
Google Translate Translate words, documents, websites in real time Free
Immersive Reader Immersive Reader, included in OneNote Learning Tools, is a full screen reading experience to increase readability of content in OneNote documents. Learning Tools is designed to support students with dyslexia and dysgraphia in the classroom, but can support anyone. Free
iMovie Create and edit videos on Mac or iPad, iPhone Free on Apple devices
ISTE Standards for Students Provides standards for the types of activities and thinking that can be effective in digital teaching and learning environments.
ISTE Standards for Teachers Provides guidance for effective digital teaching and learning both in class and in a blended environment.
Jamboard Easily collaborate using Google Tools App is free. No Jamboard necessary to use the app and collaborative tools
Kahoot Gamified quizzes for assessment Free
Keynote Create slideshow presentations on Mac, iPad, iPhone Free on Apple devices
Khan Academy A wide variety of topics and lessons for all grade levels. Free
Makecode Coding activities and tutorials in both block based coding and javascript Free
MathVisuals Visualizes math concepts to be more easily understood.
Met Kids Metropolitan Museum of Art – MetKids Online Arts resource
Metropolitan Opera Metropolitan Opera – Live Streaming HD performances nightly Performing arts resource
Microsoft Teams Learning management system Free with Microsoft account
Microsoft Translator Translate words, documents, websites in real time Free
Microsoft Whiteboard Collaborate, explain, draw, share online. Requires an Office 365 account
MoMA Museum of Modern Art – Teaching Resources Arts resource
National Standards for Quality Online Teaching These are the most current national standards for teaching online.
Nearpod Make slideshows interactive and check for students’ understanding Use premade lessons or create your own. Free and paid content
Online and Distance Learning A synthesis of various county office support documents for online and remote learning from CISC/ELA Subcommittee
PBS Great Performances PBS – Great Performances on Public Broadcasting Performing and Media Arts resource
Pear Deck Make slideshows interactive and check for students’ understanding Add-on for Google Slides
Photomath App This is a resource that helps students and parents with solving calculation math problems.
Piktochart Infographics creator
Poetry 4 Kids Poetry Writing – Elementary Lesson Plans Literary arts resource
Poetry Out Loud Poetry Out Loud – High School Lesson Plans Literary arts resource
Powerschool Learning management system Paid
Quizizz Self-paced, gamified quizzes for student assessment. Library of Free
ReadWorks Grade level specific reading materials Free
Read&Write for Google Chrome Google Chrome extension adds accessibility features for reading and writing. Also supports language learners with translation features Free and paid
Scholastic – Poetry Workshop Poetry Works: Grades 6 -8 Literary arts resource
Scratch/Scratch Jr. Block coding software allows students to create multimedia presentations. Free
Screencastify Capture video with webcam or video of computer screen/tabs Free and paid features
Swift Playgrounds Full curriculum to teach computer science. Available for free on Mac or iPad Free on Apple devices
Typing.com Typing practice for kids Requires student to create a free account
WeVideo Edit video and create movies Free and paid features
Zoom Conferencing Video conference software. Share screens, files, record meeting Free and paid tools

li.span: : Governor Newsom Issues Executive Order to Suspend Standardized Testing for Students in Response to COVID-19 Outbreak

ul.li: CDE Assessment Spotlight, Issue 85: CDE is suspending CAASPP testing, Summative ELPAC testing, placing Physical Fitness Test on hold until students return, Canceling the CA High School Proficiency Exam March administration, placing high school equivalency testing on hold. The CDE is working with the California State Board of Education to seek waiver authority afforded by the US Department of Education to waive federal testing requirements.

strong.a: US Department of Education streamlines the assessment and accountability waiver process

ul.li: Waiver request letter from CDE/SBE to US Department of Education (March 26, 2020)

a.span: Preliminary approval from US Department of Education

li.span: for all stakeholders and local educational agencies with the submission of the waiver application through April 15, 2020.

strong.a: Smarter Balanced Interim Assessments Available for Remote Administration

li.a: Handout: How Students Take CAASPP Interim Assessments at Home
Handout: Administering Smarter Balanced Interim Assessments Remotely—Quick Guide for Teachers

li.span: Advanced Placement (AP): For the 2019–2020 exam administration only, students can take a 45-minute online free-response exam at home. The College Board is providing free resources to support remote learning, and working on a plan for students to take AP Exams from home. Learn details at

a.span: AP Updates for Schools Impacted by Coronavirus.

li.span: Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT): The College Board has canceled the May 2 administration, as well as the makeup test dates for March. Keep up to date on SAT cancellations, makeups, refunds, and more at

American College Testing (ACT): ACT has rescheduled its April 4 national test date to June 13 across the U.S. in response to concerns about the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19). Find Frequently Asked Questions at

International Baccalaureate (IB): The May 2020 examinations as scheduled between April 30 and 22 May 22 for Diploma Program and Career-related Program candidates will no longer be held. Read more details on
CALPADS: Certification deadline for the Fall 2 submission extended from March 20, 2020 to April 24, 2020 (
from CDE related to funding and Calculating and Reporting P-2 and Annual Attendance
Comprehensive Support and Improvement (CSI): Expenditure reports for 2018-2019 CSI funds due
. Extension can be requested via email to
